summary: This is an email chain between attorneys Douglas Wigdor and Jeanne M. Christensen discussing a CNBC article about a woman dropping a claim of rape against Leon Black at Jeffrey Epstein's mansion. The email includes a link to the article and standard attorney confidentiality notices.

persons.name: Douglas Wigdor
persons.context: Attorney who sent an email to Jeanne M. Christensen regarding a CNBC article about a legal claim involving Leon Black and Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeanne M. Christensen
persons.context: Attorney who received an email from Douglas Wigdor regarding a CNBC article about a legal claim.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Mentioned in the CNBC article as the person against whom a rape claim was dropped; the alleged incident occurred at Jeffrey Epstein's mansion.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of his mansion being the alleged location of an incident involving Leon Black.

connections.description: Attorneys communicating via email about a legal news article.
Connected by an alleged incident at Epstein's mansion involving Black.

events.title: CNBC Article Published
events.description: CNBC publishes an article titled 'Woman drops claim of Leon Black rape at Jeffrey Epstein mansion'.

events.title: Attorney Email Exchange
events.description: Attorneys Douglas Wigdor and Jeanne M. Christensen exchange emails discussing the CNBC article.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A CNBC article from February 20, 2024, reported that a woman dropped a claim of rape against Leon Black.
The alleged incident involving Leon Black was said to have occurred at Jeffrey Epstein's mansion.
Attorneys Douglas Wigdor and Jeanne M. Christensen discussed this article via email on March 20, 2024.
The email correspondence includes standard attorney-client confidentiality and privilege notices.
